file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-20-45-06 - REAR FUSELAGE I - BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT TOP - INTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL REAR FUSELAGE I - BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT TOP - INTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: CLASS-D BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the visual inspection of rear fuselage I - baggage compartment top for general condition. B. Related Zones: 273/274. C. Zone Boundaries: STA X = 20793.0 thru STA X = 25581.0. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY REAR FUSELAGE I - BAGGAGE COM- CLASS-D BAGGAGE 05-20-45-200-801-A ♦ PARTMENT TOP - INTERNAL GENERAL COMPARTMENT VISUAL INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-20-45 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-20-45-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: CLASS-D BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT 2. REAR FUSELAGE I - BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT TOP - INTERNAL GENERAL VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This procedure obeys the EWIS ICA requirement. (2) This task gives instructions to do SMRD Zonal Task 53-Z273-214-001-A00. (3) You must do the internal general visual inspection (GVI) of rear fuselage I, at zones 273/274, within a touching distance of the items examined. (4) The function of the internal general visual inspection (GVI) is to find damage, failure, or irregular conditions that can be easily seen. (5) Apart from any specific targets defined in the Zonal Inspection task, a General Visual Inspection (GVI) must be conducted of the entire zone specified and includes all installations, components and structures. Refer to AMM Introduction for zonal inspection criteria. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400 - WM 20-22-00 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 273 273ATC Baggage compartment 273 273BTC Baggage compartment 273 273CTC Baggage compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Standard Ladder To get access to the inspection area Standard Flashlight To make the inspection of the area easier E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-45 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Rear fuselage I - baggage compartment 1 Does the task top I. Preparation (Figure 601) (Figure 602) SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the ladder in position. (2) Open access panel 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) (Figure 601). (3) Remove baggage compartment linings 273ATC, 273BTC, and 273CTC ( AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400) (Figure 602). (4) Remove the thermoacoustic insulation from rear fuselage I to zones 273/274 (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400). J. Internal General Visual Inspection (Figure 603) (Figure 604) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Examine the interior of the zone for loose rivets, skin deformation, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, deteriorated protective treatment, and foreign objects (Figure 603). (2) Examine the interior of the zone for loose rivets, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment at stringers, frames/bulkheads, splices, and circumferential splices. (3) Examine the interior of the zone for leakage signs, broken strands, failure (e.g., dirty, bent, disconnected, cracked, or crushed duct), and signs of overheating caused by leakage at the connection of the tubing. (4) NOTE: The paragraph in step (4) is applicable to aircraft that have Class-D Baggage Compartment. Examine the interior of the zone for leakage signs, broken strands, and loose parts of the rudder control cables (Figure 604). (5) Examine the EWIS components for signs of damage, adequate installation, chafing and general condition. Refer to WM 20-22-00. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the thermoacoustic insulation to zones 273/274 (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801- A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-45 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install baggage compartment linings 273ATC, 273BTC, and 273CTC ( AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400). (3) Close access panel 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) Remove the ladder. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-45 Page 4 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

A 1 INTERNALLY INSPECT SKIN PANEL AT STRINGERS AND FRAMES/BULKHEAD. 2 INTERNALLY INSPECT SKIN LONGITUDINAL AND CIRCUMFERENTIAL SPLICES.
